1718    def _analyze_and_visualize_grna_correlation(df, grna_list, save_folder, save=False):
1719        """
1720        Analyze and visualize the correlation matrix of gRNAs based on their fractions and overlap.
1721
1722        Parameters:
1723        df (pd.DataFrame): DataFrame with columns ['grna', 'fraction', 'prc'].
1724        grna_list (list): List of gRNAs to include in the correlation analysis.
1725        save_folder (str): Path to the folder where figures and data will be saved.
1726
1727        Returns:
1728        pd.DataFrame: Correlation matrix of the gRNAs.
1729        """
1730        # Filter the DataFrame to include only rows with gRNAs in the list
1731        filtered_df = df[df['grna'].isin(grna_list)]
1732
1733        # Pivot the data to create a prc-by-gRNA matrix, using fractions as values
1734        pivot_df = filtered_df.pivot_table(index='prc', columns='grna', values='fraction', aggfunc='sum').fillna(0)
1735
1736        # Compute the correlation matrix
1737        correlation_matrix = pivot_df.corr()
1738        
1739        if save:
1740            # Save the correlation matrix
1741            correlation_matrix.to_csv(os.path.join(save_folder, 'correlation_matrix.csv'))
1742        
1743        # Visualize the correlation matrix as a heatmap
1744        plt.figure(figsize=(10, 8))
1745        sns.heatmap(correlation_matrix, annot=False, cmap='coolwarm', cbar=True)
1746        plt.title('gRNA Correlation Matrix')
1747        plt.xlabel('gRNAs')
1748        plt.ylabel('gRNAs')
1749        plt.tight_layout()
1750        
1751        if save:
1752            correlation_fig_path = os.path.join(save_folder, 'correlation_matrix_heatmap.pdf')
1753            plt.savefig(correlation_fig_path, dpi=300)
1754        
1755        plt.show()
1756
1757        return correlation_matrix
1758
1759    def _compute_effect_sizes(correlation_matrix, grna_dict, save_folder, save=False):
1760        """
1761        Compute and visualize the effect sizes of gRNAs given fixed effect sizes for a subset of gRNAs.
1762
1763        Parameters:
1764        correlation_matrix (pd.DataFrame): Correlation matrix of gRNAs.
1765        grna_dict (dict): Dictionary of gRNAs with fixed effect sizes {grna_name: effect_size}.
1766        save_folder (str): Path to the folder where figures and data will be saved.
1767
1768        Returns:
1769        pd.Series: Effect sizes of all gRNAs.
1770        """
1771        # Ensure the matrix is symmetric and normalize values to 0-1
1772        corr_matrix = correlation_matrix.copy()
1773        corr_matrix = (corr_matrix - corr_matrix.min().min()) / (corr_matrix.max().max() - corr_matrix.min().min())
1774
1775        # Initialize the effect sizes with dtype float
1776        effect_sizes = pd.Series(0.0, index=corr_matrix.index)
1777
1778        # Set the effect sizes for the specified gRNAs
1779        for grna, size in grna_dict.items():
1780            effect_sizes[grna] = size
1781
1782        # Propagate the effect sizes
1783        for grna in corr_matrix.index:
1784            if grna not in grna_dict:
1785                # Weighted sum of correlations with the fixed gRNAs
1786                effect_sizes[grna] = np.dot(corr_matrix.loc[grna], effect_sizes) / np.sum(corr_matrix.loc[grna])
1787        
1788        if save:
1789            # Save the effect sizes
1790            effect_sizes.to_csv(os.path.join(save_folder, 'effect_sizes.csv'))
1791
1792        # Visualization
1793        plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
1794        sns.barplot(x=effect_sizes.index, y=effect_sizes.values, palette="viridis", hue=None, legend=False)
1795
1796        #for i, val in enumerate(effect_sizes.values):
1797        #    plt.text(i, val + 0.02, f"{val:.2f}", ha='center', va='bottom', fontsize=9)
1798        plt.title("Effect Sizes of gRNAs")
1799        plt.xlabel("gRNAs")
1800        plt.ylabel("Effect Size")
1801        plt.xticks(rotation=45)
1802        plt.tight_layout()
1803        
1804        if save:
1805            effect_sizes_fig_path = os.path.join(save_folder, 'effect_sizes_barplot.pdf')
1806            plt.savefig(effect_sizes_fig_path, dpi=300)
1807        
1808        plt.show()
1809
1810        return effect_sizes
1811    
1812    # Ensure the save folder exists
1813    save_folder = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(csv_file), 'post_regression_analysis_results')
1814    os.makedirs(save_folder, exist_ok=True)
1815    
1816    # Load the data
1817    df = pd.read_csv(csv_file)
1818    
1819    # Perform analysis
1820    correlation_matrix = _analyze_and_visualize_grna_correlation(df, grna_list, save_folder, save)
1821    effect_sizes = _compute_effect_sizes(correlation_matrix, grna_dict, save_folder, save)
class CellposeLazyDataset(typing.Generic[+T_co]): 
37class CellposeLazyDataset(Dataset):
38    def __init__(self, image_files, label_files, settings, randomize=True, augment=False):
39        combined = list(zip(image_files, label_files))
40        if randomize:
41            random.shuffle(combined)
42        self.image_files, self.label_files = zip(*combined)
43        self.normalize = settings['normalize']
44        self.percentiles = settings.get('percentiles', [2, 99])
45        self.target_size = settings['target_size']
46        self.augment = augment
47
48    def __len__(self):
49        return len(self.image_files) * (8 if self.augment else 1)
50
51    def apply_augmentation(self, image, label, aug_idx):
52        if aug_idx == 1:
53            return rotate(image, 90, resize=False, preserve_range=True), rotate(label, 90, resize=False, preserve_range=True)
54        elif aug_idx == 2:
55            return rotate(image, 180, resize=False, preserve_range=True), rotate(label, 180, resize=False, preserve_range=True)
56        elif aug_idx == 3:
57            return rotate(image, 270, resize=False, preserve_range=True), rotate(label, 270, resize=False, preserve_range=True)
58        elif aug_idx == 4:
59            return np.fliplr(image), np.fliplr(label)
60        elif aug_idx == 5:
61            return np.flipud(image), np.flipud(label)
62        elif aug_idx == 6:
63            return np.fliplr(rotate(image, 90, resize=False, preserve_range=True)), np.fliplr(rotate(label, 90, resize=False, preserve_range=True))
64        elif aug_idx == 7:
65            return np.flipud(rotate(image, 90, resize=False, preserve_range=True)), np.flipud(rotate(label, 90, resize=False, preserve_range=True))
66        return image, label
67
68    def __getitem__(self, idx):
69        base_idx = idx // 8 if self.augment else idx
70        aug_idx = idx % 8 if self.augment else 0
71
72        image = cp_io.imread(self.image_files[base_idx])
73        label = cp_io.imread(self.label_files[base_idx])
74
75        if image.ndim == 3:
76            image = image.mean(axis=-1)
77
78        if image.max() > 1:
79            image = image / image.max()
80
81        if self.normalize:
82            lower_p, upper_p = np.percentile(image, self.percentiles)
83            image = rescale_intensity(image, in_range=(lower_p, upper_p), out_range=(0, 1))
84
85        image, label = self.apply_augmentation(image, label, aug_idx)
86
87        image_shape = (self.target_size, self.target_size)
88        image = sk_resize(image, image_shape, preserve_range=True, anti_aliasing=True).astype(np.float32)
89        label = sk_resize(label, image_shape, order=0, preserve_range=True, anti_aliasing=False).astype(np.uint8)
90
91        return image, label

An abstract class representing a Dataset.

All datasets that represent a map from keys to data samples should subclass it. All subclasses should overwrite __getitem__(), supporting fetching a data sample for a given key. Subclasses could also optionally overwrite __len__(), which is expected to return the size of the dataset by many ~torch.utils.data.Sampler implementations and the default options of ~torch.utils.data.DataLoader. Subclasses could also optionally implement __getitems__(), for speedup batched samples loading. This method accepts list of indices of samples of batch and returns list of samples.

sampler that yields integral indices. To make it work with a map-style dataset with non-integral indices/keys, a custom sampler must be provided.

106
107    save_settings(settings, name=model_name)
108
109    model = cp_models.CellposeModel(gpu=True, model_type='cyto', diam_mean=30, pretrained_model='cyto')
110    cp_channels = [0, 0]
111
112    #train_image_files = sorted([os.path.join(img_src, f) for f in os.listdir(img_src) if f.endswith('.tif')])
113    #train_label_files = sorted([os.path.join(mask_src, f) for f in os.listdir(mask_src) if f.endswith('.tif')])
114    
115    image_filenames = set(f for f in os.listdir(img_src) if f.endswith('.tif'))
116    label_filenames = set(f for f in os.listdir(mask_src) if f.endswith('.tif'))
117
118    # Only keep files that are present in both folders
119    matched_filenames = sorted(image_filenames & label_filenames)
120
121    train_image_files = [os.path.join(img_src, f) for f in matched_filenames]
122    train_label_files = [os.path.join(mask_src, f) for f in matched_filenames]
123
124    train_dataset = CellposeLazyDataset(train_image_files, train_label_files, settings, randomize=True, augment=settings['augment'])
125
126    n_aug = 8 if settings['augment'] else 1
127    max_base_images = len(train_dataset) // n_aug if settings['augment'] else len(train_dataset)
128    n_base = min(settings['batch_size'], max_base_images)
129
130    unique_base_indices = list(range(max_base_images))
131    random.shuffle(unique_base_indices)
132    selected_indices = unique_base_indices[:n_base]
133
134    images, labels = [], []
135    for idx in selected_indices:
136        for aug_idx in range(n_aug):
137            i = idx * n_aug + aug_idx if settings['augment'] else idx
138            img, lbl = train_dataset[i]
139            images.append(img)
140            labels.append(lbl)
141    try:
142        plot_cellpose_batch(images, labels)
143    except:
144        print(f"could not print batch images")
145        
146    print(f"Training model with {len(images)} ber patch for {settings['n_epochs']} Epochs")
147
148    train_cp.train_seg(model.net,
149                       train_data=images,
150                       train_labels=labels,
151                       channels=cp_channels,
152                       save_path=model_save_path,
153                       n_epochs=settings['n_epochs'],
154                       batch_size=settings['batch_size'],
155                       learning_rate=settings['learning_rate'],
156                       weight_decay=settings['weight_decay'],
157                       model_name=model_name,
158                       save_every=max(1, (settings['n_epochs'] // 10)),
159                       rescale=False)
160
161    print(f"Model saved at: {model_save_path}/{model_name}")
def test_cellpose_model(settings): 
163def test_cellpose_model(settings):
164    
165    from spacr.utils import save_settings, print_progress
166    from .settings import get_default_test_cellpose_model_settings
167    
168    def plot_cellpose_resilts(i, j, results_dir, img, lbl, pred, flow):
169        from spacr. plot import generate_mask_random_cmap
170        fig, axs = plt.subplots(1, 5, figsize=(16, 4), gridspec_kw={'wspace': 0.1, 'hspace': 0.1})
171        cmap_lbl = generate_mask_random_cmap(lbl)
172        cmap_pred = generate_mask_random_cmap(pred)
173
174        axs[0].imshow(img, cmap='gray')
175        axs[0].set_title('Image')
176        axs[0].axis('off')
177
178        axs[1].imshow(lbl, cmap=cmap_lbl, interpolation='nearest')
179        axs[1].set_title('True Mask')
180        axs[1].axis('off')
181
182        axs[2].imshow(pred, cmap=cmap_pred, interpolation='nearest')
183        axs[2].set_title('Predicted Mask')
184        axs[2].axis('off')
185        
186        axs[3].imshow(flow[2], cmap='gray')
187        axs[3].set_title('Cell Probability')
188        axs[3].axis('off')
189
190        axs[4].imshow(flow[0], cmap='gray')
191        axs[4].set_title('Flows')
192        axs[4].axis('off')
193
194        save_path = os.path.join(results_dir, f"cellpose_result_{i+j:03d}.png")
195        plt.savefig(save_path, dpi=200, bbox_inches='tight')
196        plt.show()
197        plt.close(fig)
198        
199        
200    settings = get_default_test_cellpose_model_settings(settings)
201        
202    save_settings(settings, name='test_cellpose_model')
203    test_image_folder = os.path.join(settings['src'], 'test', 'images')
204    test_label_folder = os.path.join(settings['src'], 'test', 'masks')
205    results_dir = os.path.join(settings['src'], 'results')
206    os.makedirs(results_dir, exist_ok=True)
207    
208    print(f"Results will be saved in: {results_dir}")
209
210    image_filenames = set(f for f in os.listdir(test_image_folder) if f.endswith('.tif'))
211    label_filenames = set(f for f in os.listdir(test_label_folder) if f.endswith('.tif'))
212
213    # Only keep files that are present in both folders
214    matched_filenames = sorted(image_filenames & label_filenames)
215
216    test_image_files = [os.path.join(test_image_folder, f) for f in matched_filenames]
217    test_label_files = [os.path.join(test_label_folder, f) for f in matched_filenames]
218
219    print(f"Found {len(test_image_files)} images and {len(test_label_files)} masks")
220
221    test_dataset = CellposeLazyDataset(test_image_files, test_label_files, settings, randomize=False, augment=False)
222
223    model = cp_models.CellposeModel(gpu=True, pretrained_model=settings['model_path'])
224
225    batch_size = settings['batch_size']
226    scores = []
227    names = []
228    time_ls = []
229    
230    files_to_process = len(test_image_folder)
231
232    for i in range(0, len(test_dataset), batch_size):
233        start = time.time()
234        batch = [test_dataset[j] for j in range(i, min(i + batch_size, len(test_dataset)))]
235        images, labels = zip(*batch)
236
237        masks_pred, flows, _ = model.eval(x=list(images),
238                                          channels=[0, 0],
239                                          normalize=False,
240                                          diameter=30,
241                                          flow_threshold=settings['FT'],
242                                          cellprob_threshold=settings['CP_probability'],
243                                          rescale=None,     
244                                          resample=True,
245                                          interp=True,
246                                          anisotropy=None,
247                                          min_size=5,         
248                                          augment=True,
249                                          tile=True,
250                                          tile_overlap=0.2,
251                                          bsize=224)
252        
253        n_objects_true_ls = []
254        n_objects_pred_ls = []
255        mean_area_true_ls = []
256        mean_area_pred_ls = []
257        tp_ls, fp_ls, fn_ls = [], [], []
258        precision_ls, recall_ls, f1_ls, accuracy_ls = [], [], [], []
259
260        for j, (img, lbl, pred, flow) in enumerate(zip(images, labels, masks_pred, flows)):
261            score = float(aggregated_jaccard_index([lbl], [pred]))
262            fname = os.path.basename(test_label_files[i + j])
263            scores.append(score)
264            names.append(fname)
265
266            # Label masks
267            lbl_lab = label(lbl)
268            pred_lab = label(pred)
269
270            # Count objects
271            n_true = lbl_lab.max()
272            n_pred = pred_lab.max()
273            n_objects_true_ls.append(n_true)
274            n_objects_pred_ls.append(n_pred)
275
276            # Mean object size (area)
277            area_true = [p.area for p in regionprops(lbl_lab)]
278            area_pred = [p.area for p in regionprops(pred_lab)]
279
280            mean_area_true = np.mean(area_true) if area_true else 0
281            mean_area_pred = np.mean(area_pred) if area_pred else 0
282            mean_area_true_ls.append(mean_area_true)
283            mean_area_pred_ls.append(mean_area_pred)
284            
285            # Compute object-level TP, FP, FN
286            ap, tp, fp, fn = average_precision([lbl], [pred], threshold=[0.5])
287            tp, fp, fn = int(tp[0, 0]), int(fp[0, 0]), int(fn[0, 0])
288            tp_ls.append(tp)
289            fp_ls.append(fp)
290            fn_ls.append(fn)
291
292            # Precision, Recall, F1, Accuracy
293            prec = tp / (tp + fp) if (tp + fp) > 0 else 0
294            rec = tp / (tp + fn) if (tp + fn) > 0 else 0
295            f1 = 2 * prec * rec / (prec + rec) if (prec + rec) > 0 else 0
296            acc = tp / (tp + fp + fn) if (tp + fp + fn) > 0 else 0
297
298            precision_ls.append(prec)
299            recall_ls.append(rec)
300            f1_ls.append(f1)
301            accuracy_ls.append(acc)
302
303            if settings['save']:
304                plot_cellpose_resilts(i, j, results_dir, img, lbl, pred, flow)
305
306            if settings['save']:
307                plot_cellpose_resilts(i,j,results_dir, img, lbl, pred, flow)
308                
309        stop = time.time()
310        duration = stop-start
311        files_processed = (i+1) * batch_size
312        time_ls.append(duration)
313        print_progress(files_processed, files_to_process, n_jobs=1, time_ls=None, batch_size=batch_size, operation_type="test custom cellpose model")
314
315    df_results = pd.DataFrame({
316        'label_image': names,
317        'Jaccard': scores,
318        'n_objects_true': n_objects_true_ls,
319        'n_objects_pred': n_objects_pred_ls,
320        'mean_area_true': mean_area_true_ls,
321        'mean_area_pred': mean_area_pred_ls,
322        'TP': tp_ls,
323        'FP': fp_ls,
324        'FN': fn_ls,
325        'Precision': precision_ls,
326        'Recall': recall_ls,
327        'F1': f1_ls,
328        'Accuracy': accuracy_ls
329    })
330    
331    df_results['n_error'] = abs(df_results['n_objects_pred'] - df_results['n_objects_true'])
332
333    print(f"Average true objects/image: {df_results['n_objects_true'].mean():.2f}")
334    print(f"Average predicted objects/image: {df_results['n_objects_pred'].mean():.2f}")
335    print(f"Mean object area (true): {df_results['mean_area_true'].mean():.2f} px")
336    print(f"Mean object area (pred): {df_results['mean_area_pred'].mean():.2f} px")
337    print(f"Average Jaccard score: {df_results['Jaccard'].mean():.4f}")
338    
339    print(f"Average Precision: {df_results['Precision'].mean():.3f}")
340    print(f"Average Recall: {df_results['Recall'].mean():.3f}")
341    print(f"Average F1-score: {df_results['F1'].mean():.3f}")
342    print(f"Average Accuracy: {df_results['Accuracy'].mean():.3f}")
343
344    display(df_results)
345
346    if settings['save']:
347        df_results.to_csv(os.path.join(results_dir, 'test_results.csv'), index=False)
def apply_cellpose_model(settings): 
349def apply_cellpose_model(settings):
350    
351    from .settings import get_default_apply_cellpose_model_settings
352    from spacr.utils import save_settings, print_progress
353    
354    def plot_cellpose_result(i, j, results_dir, img, pred, flow):
355        
356        from .plot import generate_mask_random_cmap  
357        
358        fig, axs = plt.subplots(1, 4, figsize=(16, 4), gridspec_kw={'wspace': 0.1, 'hspace': 0.1})
359        cmap_pred = generate_mask_random_cmap(pred)
360
361        axs[0].imshow(img, cmap='gray')
362        axs[0].set_title('Image')
363        axs[0].axis('off')
364
365        axs[1].imshow(pred, cmap=cmap_pred, interpolation='nearest')
366        axs[1].set_title('Predicted Mask')
367        axs[1].axis('off')
368        
369        axs[2].imshow(flow[2], cmap='gray')
370        axs[2].set_title('Cell Probability')
371        axs[2].axis('off')
372        
373        axs[3].imshow(flow[0], cmap='gray')
374        axs[3].set_title('Flows')
375        axs[3].axis('off')
376
377        save_path = os.path.join(results_dir, f"cellpose_result_{i + j:03d}.png")
378        plt.savefig(save_path, dpi=200, bbox_inches='tight')
379        plt.show()
380        plt.close(fig)
381        
382        
383    settings = get_default_apply_cellpose_model_settings(settings)
384    save_settings(settings, name='apply_cellpose_model')
385
386    image_folder = os.path.join(settings['src'])
387    results_dir = os.path.join(settings['src'], 'results')
388    os.makedirs(results_dir, exist_ok=True)
389    print(f"Results will be saved in: {results_dir}")
390
391    image_files = sorted([os.path.join(image_folder, f) for f in os.listdir(image_folder) if f.endswith('.tif')])
392    print(f"Found {len(image_files)} images")
393
394    dummy_labels = [image_files[0]] * len(image_files)
395    dataset = CellposeLazyDataset(image_files, dummy_labels, settings, randomize=False, augment=False)
396
397    model = cp_models.CellposeModel(gpu=True, pretrained_model=settings['model_path'])
398    batch_size = settings['batch_size']
399    measurements = []
400    
401    files_to_process = len(image_files)
402    time_ls = []
403
404    for i in range(0, len(dataset), batch_size):
405        start = time.time() 
406        batch = [dataset[j] for j in range(i, min(i + batch_size, len(dataset)))]
407        images, _ = zip(*batch)
408        
409        X = list(images)
410        
411        print(settings['CP_probability'])
412        masks_pred, flows, _ = model.eval(x=list(images),
413                                          channels=[0, 0],
414                                          normalize=False,
415                                          diameter=30,
416                                          flow_threshold=settings['FT'],
417                                          cellprob_threshold=settings['CP_probability'],
418                                          rescale=None,     
419                                          resample=True,
420                                          interp=True,
421                                          anisotropy=None,
422                                          min_size=5,         
423                                          augment=True,
424                                          tile=True,
425                                          tile_overlap=0.2,
426                                          bsize=224)
427        
428        for j, (img, pred, flow) in enumerate(zip(images, masks_pred, flows)):
429            fname = os.path.basename(image_files[i + j])
430
431            if settings.get('circularize', False):
432                h, w = pred.shape
433                Y, X = np.ogrid[:h, :w]
434                center_x, center_y = w / 2, h / 2
435                radius = min(center_x, center_y)
436                circular_mask = (X - center_x)**2 + (Y - center_y)**2 <= radius**2
437                pred = pred * circular_mask
438
439            if settings['save']:
440                plot_cellpose_result(i, j, results_dir, img, pred, flow)
441
442            props = regionprops(sklabel(pred))
443            for k, prop in enumerate(props):
444                measurements.append({
445                    'image': fname,
446                    'object_id': k + 1,
447                    'area': prop.area
448                })
449                
450        stop = time.time()            
451        duration = stop-start
452        files_processed = (i+1) * batch_size
453        time_ls.append(duration)
454        print_progress(files_processed, files_to_process, n_jobs=1, time_ls=None, batch_size=batch_size, operation_type="apply custom cellpose model")
455
456
457        # Write after each batch
458        df_measurements = pd.DataFrame(measurements)
459        df_measurements.to_csv(os.path.join(results_dir, 'measurements.csv'), index=False)
460        print("Saved object counts and areas to measurements.csv")
461
462        df_summary = df_measurements.groupby('image').agg(
463            object_count=('object_id', 'count'),
464            average_area=('area', 'mean')
465        ).reset_index()
466        df_summary.to_csv(os.path.join(results_dir, 'summary.csv'), index=False)
467        print("Saved object count and average area to summary.csv")

def analyze_percent_positive(settings): 
484def analyze_percent_positive(settings):
485    from spacr.io import _read_and_merge_data
486    from spacr.utils import save_settings
487    from .settings import default_settings_analyze_percent_positive
488    
489    settings = default_settings_analyze_percent_positive(settings)
490    
491    def translate_well_in_df(csv_loc):
492        # Load and extract metadata
493        df = pd.read_csv(csv_loc)
494        df[['plateID', 'well']] = df['Renamed TIFF'].str.replace('.tif', '', regex=False).str.split('_', expand=True)[[0, 1]]
495        df['plate_well'] = df['plateID'] + '_' + df['well']
496
497        # Retain one row per plate_well
498        df_2 = df.drop_duplicates(subset='plate_well').copy()
499
500        # Translate well to row and column
501        df_2['rowID'] = 'r' + df_2['well'].str[0].map(lambda x: str(string.ascii_uppercase.index(x) + 1))
502        df_2['column_name'] = 'c' + df_2['well'].str[1:].astype(int).astype(str)
503
504        # Optional: add prcf ID (plate_row_column_field)
505        df_2['fieldID'] = 'f1'  # default or extract from filename if needed
506        df_2['prc'] = 'p' + df_2['plateID'].str.extract(r'(\d+)')[0] + '_' + df_2['rowID'] + '_' + df_2['column_name']
507
508        return df_2
509    
510    def annotate_and_summarize(df, value_col, condition_col, well_col, threshold, annotation_col='annotation'):
511        """
512        Annotate and summarize a DataFrame based on a threshold.
513
514        Parameters:
515        - df: pandas.DataFrame
516        - value_col: str, column name to apply threshold on
517        - condition_col: str, column name for experimental condition
518        - well_col: str, column name for wells
519        - threshold: float, threshold value for annotation
520        - annotation_col: str, name of the new annotation column
521
522        Returns:
523        - df: annotated DataFrame
524        - summary_df: DataFrame with counts and fractions per condition and well
525        """
526        # Annotate
527        df[annotation_col] = np.where(df[value_col] > threshold, 'above', 'below')
528
529        # Count per condition and well
530        count_df = df.groupby([condition_col, well_col, annotation_col]).size().unstack(fill_value=0)
531
532        # Calculate total and fractions
533        count_df['total'] = count_df.sum(axis=1)
534        count_df['fraction_above'] = count_df.get('above', 0) / count_df['total']
535        count_df['fraction_below'] = count_df.get('below', 0) / count_df['total']
536
537        return df, count_df.reset_index()
538    
539    save_settings(settings, name='analyze_percent_positive', show=False)
540    
541    df, _ = _read_and_merge_data(locs=[settings['src']+'/measurements/measurements.db'], 
542                             tables=settings['tables'], 
543                             verbose=True, 
544                             nuclei_limit=None, 
545                             pathogen_limit=None)
546
547    df['condition'] = 'none'
548    
549    if not settings['filter_1'] is None:
550        df = df[df[settings['filter_1'][0]]>settings['filter_1'][1]]
551    
552    condition_col = 'condition'
553    well_col = 'prc'
554    
555    df, count_df = annotate_and_summarize(df, settings['value_col'], condition_col, well_col, settings['threshold'], annotation_col='annotation')
556    count_df[['plateID', 'rowID', 'column_name']] = count_df['prc'].str.split('_', expand=True)
557    
558    csv_loc = os.path.join(settings['src'], 'rename_log.csv')
559    csv_out_loc = os.path.join(settings['src'], 'result.csv')
560    translate_df = translate_well_in_df(csv_loc)
561    
562    merged = pd.merge(count_df, translate_df, on=['rowID', 'column_name'], how='inner')
563
564    merged = merged[['plate_y', 'well', 'plate_well','fieldID','rowID','column_name','prc_x','Original File','Renamed TIFF','above','below','fraction_above','fraction_below']]
565    merged[[f'part{i}' for i in range(merged['Original File'].str.count('_').max() + 1)]] = merged['Original File'].str.split('_', expand=True)
566    merged.to_csv(csv_out_loc, index=False)
567    display(merged)
568    return merged
def analyze_recruitment(settings): 
570def analyze_recruitment(settings):
571    """
572    Analyze recruitment data by grouping the DataFrame by well coordinates and plotting controls and recruitment data.
573
574    Parameters:
575    settings (dict): settings.
576
577    Returns:
578    None
579    """

633                for idx, file in enumerate(os.listdir(merged_path)):
634                    file_path = os.path.join(merged_path,file)
635                    if idx <= settings['plot_nr']:
636                        plot_image_mask_overlay(file_path, 
637                                                settings['channel_dims'],
638                                                settings['cell_chann_dim'],
639                                                settings['nucleus_chann_dim'],
640                                                settings['pathogen_chann_dim'],
641                                                figuresize=10,
642                                                normalize=True,
643                                                thickness=3,
644                                                save_pdf=True)
645            except Exception as e:
646                print(f'Failed to plot images with outlines, Error: {e}')
647        
648    if not settings['cell_chann_dim'] is None:
649        df = _object_filter(df, 'cell', settings['cell_size_range'], settings['cell_intensity_range'], mask_chans, 0)
650        if not settings['target_intensity_min'] is None or not settings['target_intensity_min'] is 0:
651            df = df[df[f"cell_channel_{settings['channel_of_interest']}_percentile_95"] > settings['target_intensity_min']]
652            print(f"After channel {settings['channel_of_interest']} filtration", len(df))
653    if not settings['nucleus_chann_dim'] is None:
654        df = _object_filter(df, 'nucleus', settings['nucleus_size_range'], settings['nucleus_intensity_range'], mask_chans, 1)
655    if not settings['pathogen_chann_dim'] is None:
656        df = _object_filter(df, 'pathogen', settings['pathogen_size_range'], settings['pathogen_intensity_range'], mask_chans, 2)
657       
658    df['recruitment'] = df[f"pathogen_channel_{settings['channel_of_interest']}_mean_intensity"]/df[f"cytoplasm_channel_{settings['channel_of_interest']}_mean_intensity"]
659    
660    for chan in settings['channel_dims']:
661        df = _calculate_recruitment(df, channel=chan)
662    print(f'calculated recruitment for: {len(df)} rows')
663    
664    df_well = _group_by_well(df)
665    print(f'found: {len(df_well)} wells')
666    
667    df_well = df_well[df_well['cells_per_well'] >= settings['cells_per_well']]
668    prc_list = df_well['prc'].unique().tolist()
669    df = df[df['prc'].isin(prc_list)]
670    print(f"After cells per well filter: {len(df)} cells in {len(df_well)} wells left wth threshold {settings['cells_per_well']}")
671    
672    if settings['plot_control']:
673        _plot_controls(df, mask_chans, settings['channel_of_interest'], figuresize=5)
674
675    print(f'PV level: {len(df)} rows')
676    _plot_recruitment(df, 'by PV', settings['channel_of_interest'], columns=[], figuresize=settings['figuresize'])
677    print(f'well level: {len(df_well)} rows')
678    _plot_recruitment(df_well, 'by well', settings['channel_of_interest'], columns=[], figuresize=settings['figuresize'])
679    cells,wells = _results_to_csv(settings['src'], df, df_well)
680
681    return [cells,wells]

def compare_reads_to_scores( reads_csv, scores_csv, empirical_dict={'r1': (90, 10), 'r2': (90, 10), 'r3': (80, 20), 'r4': (80, 20), 'r5': (70, 30), 'r6': (70, 30), 'r7': (60, 40), 'r8': (60, 40), 'r9': (50, 50), 'r10': (50, 50), 'r11': (40, 60), 'r12': (40, 60), 'r13': (30, 70), 'r14': (30, 70), 'r15': (20, 80), 'r16': (20, 80)}, pc_grna='TGGT1_220950_1', nc_grna='TGGT1_233460_4', y_columns=['class_1_fraction', 'TGGT1_220950_1_fraction', 'nc_fraction'], column='columnID', value='c3', plate=None, save_paths=None): 
787def compare_reads_to_scores(reads_csv, scores_csv, empirical_dict={'r1':(90,10),'r2':(90,10),'r3':(80,20),'r4':(80,20),'r5':(70,30),'r6':(70,30),'r7':(60,40),'r8':(60,40),'r9':(50,50),'r10':(50,50),'r11':(40,60),'r12':(40,60),'r13':(30,70),'r14':(30,70),'r15':(20,80),'r16':(20,80)},

792    def calculate_well_score_fractions(df, class_columns='cv_predictions'):
793        if all(col in df.columns for col in ['plateID', 'rowID', 'columnID']):
794            df['prc'] = df['plateID'] + '_' + df['rowID'] + '_' + df['columnID']
795        else:
796            raise ValueError("Cannot find 'plateID', 'rowID', or 'columnID' in df.columns")
797        prc_summary = df.groupby(['plateID', 'rowID', 'columnID', 'prc']).size().reset_index(name='total_rows')
798        well_counts = (df.groupby(['plateID', 'rowID', 'columnID', 'prc', class_columns])
799                       .size()
800                       .unstack(fill_value=0)
801                       .reset_index()
802                       .rename(columns={0: 'class_0', 1: 'class_1'}))
803        summary_df = pd.merge(prc_summary, well_counts, on=['plateID', 'rowID', 'columnID', 'prc'], how='left')
804        summary_df['class_0_fraction'] = summary_df['class_0'] / summary_df['total_rows']
805        summary_df['class_1_fraction'] = summary_df['class_1'] / summary_df['total_rows']
806        return summary_df

808    def plot_line(df, x_column, y_columns, group_column=None, xlabel=None, ylabel=None, 
809                  title=None, figsize=(10, 6), save_path=None, theme='deep'):
810        """
811        Create a line plot that can handle multiple y-columns, each becoming a separate line.
812        """
813
814        def _set_theme(theme):
815            """Set the Seaborn theme and reorder colors if necessary."""
816
817            def __set_reordered_theme(theme='deep', order=None, n_colors=100, show_theme=False):
818                """Set and reorder the Seaborn color palette."""
819                palette = sns.color_palette(theme, n_colors)
820                if order:
821                    reordered_palette = [palette[i] for i in order]
822                else:
823                    reordered_palette = palette
824                if show_theme:
825                    sns.palplot(reordered_palette)
826                    plt.show()
827                return reordered_palette
828
829            integer_list = list(range(1, 81))
830            color_order = [7, 9, 4, 0, 3, 6, 2] + integer_list
831            sns_palette = __set_reordered_theme(theme, color_order, 100)
832            return sns_palette
833
834        sns_palette = _set_theme(theme)
835
836        # Sort the DataFrame based on the x_column
837        df = df.loc[natsorted(df.index, key=lambda x: df.loc[x, x_column])]
838        
839        fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=figsize)
840
841        # Handle multiple y-columns, each as a separate line
842        if isinstance(y_columns, list):
843            for idx, y_col in enumerate(y_columns):
844                sns.lineplot(
845                    data=df, x=x_column, y=y_col, ax=ax, label=y_col, 
846                    color=sns_palette[idx % len(sns_palette)], linewidth=1
847                )
848        else:
849            sns.lineplot(
850                data=df, x=x_column, y=y_columns, hue=group_column, ax=ax, 
851                palette=sns_palette, linewidth=2
852            )
853
854        # Set axis labels and title
855        ax.set_xlabel(xlabel if xlabel else x_column)
856        ax.set_ylabel(ylabel if ylabel else 'Value')
857        ax.set_title(title if title else 'Line Plot')
858
859        # Remove top and right spines
860        sns.despine(ax=ax)
861
862        # Ensure legend only appears when needed and place it to the right
863        if group_column or isinstance(y_columns, list):
864            ax.legend(title='Legend', loc='center left', bbox_to_anchor=(1, 0.5))
865
866        plt.tight_layout()
867
868        # Save the plot if a save path is provided
869        if save_path:
870            plt.savefig(save_path, format='pdf', dpi=600, bbox_inches='tight')
871            print(f"Plot saved to {save_path}")
872
873        plt.show()
874        return fig

876    def calculate_grna_fraction_ratio(df, grna1='TGGT1_220950_1', grna2='TGGT1_233460_4'):
877        # Filter relevant grna_names within each prc and group them
878        grouped = df[df['grna_name'].isin([grna1, grna2])] \
879            .groupby(['prc', 'grna_name']) \
880            .agg({'fraction': 'sum', 'count': 'sum'}) \
881            .unstack(fill_value=0)
882        grouped.columns = ['_'.join(col).strip() for col in grouped.columns.values]
883        grouped['fraction_ratio'] = grouped[f'fraction_{grna1}'] / grouped[f'fraction_{grna2}']
884        grouped = grouped.assign(
885            fraction_ratio=lambda x: x['fraction_ratio'].replace([float('inf'), -float('inf')], 0)
886        ).fillna({'fraction_ratio': 0})
887        grouped = grouped.rename(columns={
888            f'count_{grna1}': f'{grna1}_count',
889            f'count_{grna2}': f'{grna2}_count'
890        })
891        result = grouped.reset_index()[['prc', f'{grna1}_count', f'{grna2}_count', 'fraction_ratio']]
892        result['total_reads'] = result[f'{grna1}_count'] + result[f'{grna2}_count']
893        result[f'{grna1}_fraction'] = result[f'{grna1}_count'] / result['total_reads']
894        result[f'{grna2}_fraction'] = result[f'{grna2}_count'] / result['total_reads']
895        return result
896
897    def calculate_well_read_fraction(df, count_column='count'):
898        if all(col in df.columns for col in ['plateID', 'rowID', 'columnID']):
899            df['prc'] = df['plateID'] + '_' + df['rowID'] + '_' + df['columnID']
900        else:
901            raise ValueError("Cannot find plate, row or column in df.columns")
902        grouped_df = df.groupby('prc')[count_column].sum().reset_index()
903        grouped_df = grouped_df.rename(columns={count_column: 'total_counts'})
904        df = pd.merge(df, grouped_df, on='prc')
905        df['fraction'] = df['count'] / df['total_counts']
906        return df
907    
908    if isinstance(reads_csv, list):
909        if len(reads_csv) == len(scores_csv):
910            reads_ls = []
911            scores_ls = []
912            for i, reads_csv_temp in enumerate(reads_csv):
913                reads_df_temp = pd.read_csv(reads_csv_temp)
914                scores_df_temp = pd.read_csv(scores_csv[i])
915                reads_df_temp['plateID'] = f"plate{i+1}"
916                scores_df_temp['plateID'] = f"plate{i+1}"
917                
918                if 'column' in reads_df_temp.columns:
919                    reads_df_temp = reads_df_temp.rename(columns={'column': 'columnID'})
920                if 'column_name' in reads_df_temp.columns:
921                    reads_df_temp = reads_df_temp.rename(columns={'column_name': 'columnID'})
922                if 'row' in reads_df_temp.columns:
923                    reads_df_temp = reads_df_temp.rename(columns={'row_name': 'rowID'})
924                if 'row_name' in scores_df_temp.columns:
925                    scores_df_temp = scores_df_temp.rename(columns={'row_name': 'rowID'})
926                    
927                reads_ls.append(reads_df_temp)
928                scores_ls.append(scores_df_temp)
929                    
930            reads_df = pd.concat(reads_ls, axis=0)
931            scores_df = pd.concat(scores_ls, axis=0)
932            print(f"Reads: {len(reads_df)} Scores: {len(scores_df)}")
933        else:
934            print(f"reads_csv and scores_csv must contain the same number of elements if reads_csv is a list")
935    else:
936        reads_df = pd.read_csv(reads_csv)
937        scores_df = pd.read_csv(scores_csv)
938        if plate != None:
939            reads_df['plateID'] = plate
940            scores_df['plateID'] = plate
941        
942    reads_df = calculate_well_read_fraction(reads_df)
943    scores_df = calculate_well_score_fractions(scores_df)
944    reads_col_df = reads_df[reads_df[column]==value]
945    scores_col_df = scores_df[scores_df[column]==value]
946    
947    reads_col_df = calculate_grna_fraction_ratio(reads_col_df, grna1=pc_grna, grna2=nc_grna)
948    df = pd.merge(reads_col_df, scores_col_df, on='prc')
949    
950    df_emp = pd.DataFrame([(key, val[0], val[1], val[0] / (val[0] + val[1]), val[1] / (val[0] + val[1])) for key, val in empirical_dict.items()],columns=['key', 'value1', 'value2', 'pc_fraction', 'nc_fraction'])
951    
952    df = pd.merge(df, df_emp, left_on='rowID', right_on='key')
953    
954    if any in y_columns not in df.columns:
955        print(f"columns in dataframe:")
956        for col in df.columns:
957            print(col)
958        return
959    display(df)
960    fig_1 = plot_line(df, x_column = 'pc_fraction', y_columns=y_columns, group_column=None, xlabel=None, ylabel='Fraction', title=None, figsize=(10, 6), save_path=save_paths[0])
961    fig_2 = plot_line(df, x_column = 'nc_fraction', y_columns=y_columns, group_column=None, xlabel=None, ylabel='Fraction', title=None, figsize=(10, 6), save_path=save_paths[1])
962    
963    return [fig_1, fig_2]
def interperate_vision_model(settings={}): 
 965def interperate_vision_model(settings={}):

 969    def generate_comparison_columns(df, compartments=['cell', 'nucleus', 'pathogen', 'cytoplasm']):
 970
 971        comparison_dict = {}
 972
 973        # Get columns by compartment
 974        compartment_columns = {comp: [col for col in df.columns if col.startswith(comp)] for comp in compartments}
 975
 976        for comp0, comp0_columns in compartment_columns.items():
 977            for comp0_col in comp0_columns:
 978                related_cols = []
 979                base_col_name = comp0_col.replace(comp0, '')  # Base feature name without compartment prefix
 980
 981                # Look for matching columns in other compartments
 982                for prefix, prefix_columns in compartment_columns.items():
 983                    if prefix == comp0:  # Skip same-compartment comparisons
 984                        continue
 985                    # Check if related column exists in other compartment
 986                    related_col = prefix + base_col_name
 987                    if related_col in df.columns:
 988                        related_cols.append(related_col)
 989                        new_col_name = f"{prefix}_{comp0}{base_col_name}"  # Format: prefix_comp0_base
 990
 991                        # Calculate ratio and handle infinite or NaN values
 992                        df[new_col_name] = df[related_col] / df[comp0_col]
 993                        df[new_col_name].replace([float('inf'), -float('inf')], pd.NA, inplace=True)  # Replace inf values with NA
 994                        df[new_col_name].fillna(0, inplace=True)  # Replace NaN values with 0 for ease of further calculations
 995
 996                # Generate all-to-all comparisons
 997                if related_cols:
 998                    comparison_dict[comp0_col] = related_cols
 999                    for i, rel_col_1 in enumerate(related_cols):
1000                        for rel_col_2 in related_cols[i + 1:]:
1001                            # Create a new column name for each pairwise comparison
1002                            comp1, comp2 = rel_col_1.split('_')[0], rel_col_2.split('_')[0]
1003                            new_col_name_all = f"{comp1}_{comp2}{base_col_name}"
1004
1005                            # Calculate pairwise ratio and handle infinite or NaN values
1006                            df[new_col_name_all] = df[rel_col_1] / df[rel_col_2]
1007                            df[new_col_name_all].replace([float('inf'), -float('inf')], pd.NA, inplace=True)  # Replace inf with NA
1008                            df[new_col_name_all].fillna(0, inplace=True)  # Replace NaN with 0
1009
1010        return df, comparison_dict
1011
1012    def group_feature_class(df, feature_groups=['cell', 'cytoplasm', 'nucleus', 'pathogen'], name='compartment', include_all=False):
1013
1014        # Function to determine compartment based on multiple matches
1015        def find_feature_class(feature, compartments):
1016            matches = [compartment for compartment in compartments if re.search(compartment, feature)]
1017            if len(matches) > 1:
1018                return '-'.join(matches)
1019            elif matches:
1020                return matches[0]
1021            else:
1022                return None
1023
1024        from spacr.plot import spacrGraph
1025
1026        df[name] = df['feature'].apply(lambda x: find_feature_class(x, feature_groups))
1027
1028        if name == 'channel':
1029            df['channel'].fillna('morphology', inplace=True)
1030
1031        # Create new DataFrame with summed importance for each compartment and channel
1032        importance_sum = df.groupby(name)['importance'].sum().reset_index(name=f'{name}_importance_sum')
1033        
1034        if include_all:
1035            total_compartment_importance = importance_sum[f'{name}_importance_sum'].sum()
1036            importance_sum = pd.concat(
1037                [importance_sum,
1038                 pd.DataFrame(
1039                     [{name: 'all', f'{name}_importance_sum': total_compartment_importance}])]
1040                , ignore_index=True)
1041
1042        return importance_sum

1044    # Function to create radar plot for individual and combined values
1045    def create_extended_radar_plot(values, labels, title):
1046        values = list(values) + [values[0]]  # Close the loop for radar chart
1047        angles = [n / float(len(labels)) * 2 * pi for n in range(len(labels))]
1048        angles += angles[:1]
1049
1050        fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8, 8), subplot_kw=dict(polar=True))
1051        ax.plot(angles, values, linewidth=2, linestyle='solid')
1052        ax.fill(angles, values, alpha=0.25)
1053
1054        ax.set_xticks(angles[:-1])
1055        ax.set_xticklabels(labels, fontsize=10, rotation=45, ha='right')
1056        plt.title(title, pad=20)
1057        plt.show()

1059    def extract_compartment_channel(feature_name):
1060        # Identify compartment as the first part before an underscore
1061        compartment = feature_name.split('_')[0]
1062        
1063        if compartment == 'cells':
1064            compartment = 'cell'
1065
1066        # Identify channels based on substring presence
1067        channels = []
1068        if 'channel_0' in feature_name:
1069            channels.append('channel_0')
1070        if 'channel_1' in feature_name:
1071            channels.append('channel_1')
1072        if 'channel_2' in feature_name:
1073            channels.append('channel_2')
1074        if 'channel_3' in feature_name:
1075            channels.append('channel_3')
1076
1077        # If multiple channels are found, join them with a '+'
1078        if channels:
1079            channel = ' + '.join(channels)
1080        else:
1081            channel = 'morphology'  # Use 'morphology' if no channel identifier is found
1082
1083        return (compartment, channel)

1085    def read_and_preprocess_data(settings):
1086
1087        df, _ = _read_and_merge_data(
1088            locs=[settings['src']+'/measurements/measurements.db'], 
1089            tables=settings['tables'], 
1090            verbose=True, 
1091            nuclei_limit=settings['nuclei_limit'], 
1092            pathogen_limit=settings['pathogen_limit']
1093        )
1094                
1095        df, _dict = generate_comparison_columns(df, compartments=['cell', 'nucleus', 'pathogen', 'cytoplasm'])
1096        print(f"Expanded dataframe to {len(df.columns)} columns with relative features")
1097        scores_df = pd.read_csv(settings['scores'])
1098
1099        # Clean and align columns for merging
1100        df['object_label'] = df['object_label'].str.replace('o', '')
1101
1102        if 'rowID' not in scores_df.columns:
1103            if 'row' in scores_df.columns:
1104                scores_df['rowID'] = scores_df['row']
1105            if 'row_name' in scores_df.columns:
1106                scores_df['rowID'] = scores_df['row_name']
1107
1108        if 'columnID' not in scores_df.columns:
1109            if 'column_name' in scores_df.columns:
1110                scores_df['columnID'] = scores_df['column_name']
1111            if 'column' in scores_df.columns:
1112                scores_df['columnID'] = scores_df['column']
1113
1114        if 'object_label' not in scores_df.columns:
1115            scores_df['object_label'] = scores_df['object']
1116
1117        # Remove the 'o' prefix from 'object_label' in df, ensuring it is a string type
1118        df['object_label'] = df['object_label'].str.replace('o', '').astype(str)
1119
1120        # Ensure 'object_label' in scores_df is also a string
1121        scores_df['object_label'] = scores_df['object'].astype(str)
1122
1123        # Ensure all join columns have the same data type in both DataFrames
1124        df[['plateID', 'rowID', 'column_name', 'fieldID', 'object_label']] = df[['plateID', 'rowID', 'column_name', 'fieldID', 'object_label']].astype(str)
1125        scores_df[['plateID', 'rowID', 'column_name', 'fieldID', 'object_label']] = scores_df[['plateID', 'rowID', 'column_name', 'fieldID', 'object_label']].astype(str)
1126
1127        # Select only the necessary columns from scores_df for merging
1128        scores_df = scores_df[['plateID', 'rowID', 'column_name', 'fieldID', 'object_label', settings['score_column']]]
1129
1130        # Now merge DataFrames
1131        merged_df = pd.merge(df, scores_df, on=['plateID', 'rowID', 'column_name', 'fieldID', 'object_label'], how='inner')
1132
1133        # Separate numerical features and the score column
1134        X = merged_df.select_dtypes(include='number').drop(columns=[settings['score_column']])
1135        y = merged_df[settings['score_column']]
1136
1137        return X, y, merged_df
1138    
1139    X, y, merged_df = read_and_preprocess_data(settings)
1140    
1141    output = {}
1142    
1143    # Step 1: Feature Importance using Random Forest
1144    if settings['feature_importance'] or settings['feature_importance']:
1145        model = RandomForestClassifier(random_state=42, n_jobs=settings['n_jobs'])
1146        model.fit(X, y)
1147        
1148        if settings['feature_importance']:
1149            print(f"Feature Importance ...")
1150            feature_importances = model.feature_importances_
1151            feature_importance_df = pd.DataFrame({'feature': X.columns, 'importance': feature_importances})
1152            feature_importance_df = feature_importance_df.sort_values(by='importance', ascending=False)
1153            top_feature_importance_df = feature_importance_df.head(settings['top_features'])
1154
1155            # Plot Feature Importance
1156            plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
1157            plt.barh(top_feature_importance_df['feature'], top_feature_importance_df['importance'])
1158            plt.xlabel('Importance')
1159            plt.title(f"Top {settings['top_features']} Features - Feature Importance")
1160            plt.gca().invert_yaxis()
1161            plt.show()
1162            
1163        output['feature_importance'] = feature_importance_df
1164        fi_compartment_df = group_feature_class(feature_importance_df, feature_groups=settings['tables'], name='compartment', include_all=settings['include_all'])
1165        fi_channel_df = group_feature_class(feature_importance_df, feature_groups=settings['channels'], name='channel', include_all=settings['include_all'])
1166        
1167        output['feature_importance_compartment'] = fi_compartment_df
1168        output['feature_importance_channel'] = fi_channel_df
1169    
1170    # Step 2: Permutation Importance
1171    if settings['permutation_importance']:
1172        print(f"Permutation Importance ...")
1173        perm_importance = permutation_importance(model, X, y, n_repeats=10, random_state=42, n_jobs=settings['n_jobs'])
1174        perm_importance_df = pd.DataFrame({'feature': X.columns, 'importance': perm_importance.importances_mean})
1175        perm_importance_df = perm_importance_df.sort_values(by='importance', ascending=False)
1176        top_perm_importance_df = perm_importance_df.head(settings['top_features'])
1177
1178        # Plot Permutation Importance
1179        plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
1180        plt.barh(top_perm_importance_df['feature'], top_perm_importance_df['importance'])
1181        plt.xlabel('Importance')
1182        plt.title(f"Top {settings['top_features']} Features - Permutation Importance")
1183        plt.gca().invert_yaxis()
1184        plt.show()
1185            
1186        output['permutation_importance'] = perm_importance_df
1187    
1188    # Step 3: SHAP Analysis
1189    if settings['shap']:
1190        print(f"SHAP Analysis ...")
1191
1192        # Select top N features based on Random Forest importance and fit the model on these features only
1193        top_features = feature_importance_df.head(settings['top_features'])['feature']
1194        X_top = X[top_features]
1195
1196        # Refit the model on this subset of features
1197        model = RandomForestClassifier(random_state=42, n_jobs=settings['n_jobs'])
1198        model.fit(X_top, y)
1199
1200        # Sample a smaller subset of rows to speed up SHAP
1201        if settings['shap_sample']:
1202            sample = int(len(X_top) / 100)
1203            X_sample = X_top.sample(min(sample, len(X_top)), random_state=42)
1204        else:
1205            X_sample = X_top
1206
1207        # Initialize SHAP explainer with the same subset of features
1208        explainer = shap.Explainer(model.predict, X_sample)
1209        shap_values = explainer(X_sample, max_evals=1500)
1210
1211        # Plot SHAP summary for the selected sample and top features
1212        shap.summary_plot(shap_values, X_sample, max_display=settings['top_features'])
1213
1214        # Convert SHAP values to a DataFrame for easier manipulation
1215        shap_df = pd.DataFrame(shap_values.values, columns=X_sample.columns)
1216        
1217        # Apply the function to create MultiIndex columns with compartment and channel
1218        shap_df.columns = pd.MultiIndex.from_tuples(
1219            [extract_compartment_channel(feat) for feat in shap_df.columns], 
1220            names=['compartment', 'channel']
1221        )
1222        
1223        # Aggregate SHAP values by compartment and channel
1224        compartment_mean = shap_df.abs().groupby(level='compartment', axis=1).mean().mean(axis=0)
1225        channel_mean = shap_df.abs().groupby(level='channel', axis=1).mean().mean(axis=0)
1226
1227        # Calculate combined importance for each pair of compartments and channels
1228        combined_compartment = {}
1229        for i, comp1 in enumerate(compartment_mean.index):
1230            for comp2 in compartment_mean.index[i+1:]:
1231                combined_compartment[f"{comp1} + {comp2}"] = shap_df.loc[:, (comp1, slice(None))].abs().mean().mean() + \
1232                                                              shap_df.loc[:, (comp2, slice(None))].abs().mean().mean()
1233        
1234        combined_channel = {}
1235        for i, chan1 in enumerate(channel_mean.index):
1236            for chan2 in channel_mean.index[i+1:]:
1237                combined_channel[f"{chan1} + {chan2}"] = shap_df.loc[:, (slice(None), chan1)].abs().mean().mean() + \
1238                                                          shap_df.loc[:, (slice(None), chan2)].abs().mean().mean()
1239
1240        # Prepare values and labels for radar charts
1241        all_compartment_importance = list(compartment_mean.values) + list(combined_compartment.values())
1242        all_compartment_labels = list(compartment_mean.index) + list(combined_compartment.keys())
1243
1244        all_channel_importance = list(channel_mean.values) + list(combined_channel.values())
1245        all_channel_labels = list(channel_mean.index) + list(combined_channel.keys())
1246
1247        # Create radar plots for compartments and channels
1248        #create_extended_radar_plot(all_compartment_importance, all_compartment_labels, "SHAP Importance by Compartment (Individual and Combined)")
1249        #create_extended_radar_plot(all_channel_importance, all_channel_labels, "SHAP Importance by Channel (Individual and Combined)")
1250        
1251        output['shap'] = shap_df
1252        
1253    if settings['save']:
1254        dst = os.path.join(settings['src'], 'results')
1255        os.makedirs(dst, exist_ok=True)
1256        for key, df in output.items(): 
1257            save_path = os.path.join(dst, f"{key}.csv")
1258            df.to_csv(save_path)
1259            print(f"Saved {save_path}")
1260        
1261    return output

1312def analyze_endodyogeny(settings):
1313    
1314    from .utils import annotate_conditions, save_settings

1319    def _calculate_volume_bins(df, compartment='pathogen', min_area_bin=500, max_bins=None, verbose=False):
1320        area_column = f'{compartment}_area'
1321        df[f'{compartment}_volume'] = df[area_column] ** 1.5
1322        min_volume_bin = min_area_bin ** 1.5
1323        max_volume = df[f'{compartment}_volume'].max()
1324
1325        # Generate bin edges as floats, and filter out any duplicate edges
1326        bins = [min_volume_bin * (2 ** i) for i in range(int(np.ceil(np.log2(max_volume / min_volume_bin)) + 1))]
1327        bins = sorted(set(bins))  # Ensure bin edges are unique
1328
1329        # Create bin labels as ranges with decimal precision for float values (e.g., "500.0-1000.0")
1330        bin_labels = [f"{bins[i]:.2f}-{bins[i+1]:.2f}" for i in range(len(bins) - 1)]
1331        if verbose:
1332            print('Volume bins:', bins)
1333            print('Volume bin labels:', bin_labels)
1334
1335        # Apply the bins to create a new column with the binned labels
1336        df[f'{compartment}_volume_bin'] = pd.cut(df[f'{compartment}_volume'], bins=bins, labels=bin_labels, right=False)
1337        
1338        # Create a bin index column (numeric version of bins)
1339        df['bin_index'] = pd.cut(df[f'{compartment}_volume'], bins=bins, labels=range(1, len(bins)), right=False).astype(int)
1340
1341        # Adjust bin indices and labels based on max_bins
1342        if max_bins is not None:
1343            df.loc[df['bin_index'] > max_bins, 'bin_index'] = max_bins
1344            
1345            # Update bin labels to reflect capped bins
1346            bin_labels = bin_labels[:max_bins - 1] + [f">{bins[max_bins - 1]:.2f}"]
1347            df[f'{compartment}_volume_bin'] = df['bin_index'].map(
1348                {i + 1: label for i, label in enumerate(bin_labels)}
1349            )
1350
1351        if verbose:
1352            print(df[[f'{compartment}_volume', f'{compartment}_volume_bin', 'bin_index']].head())
1353
1354        return df
1355

1361    if not isinstance(settings['src'], list):

1379    )
1380    
1381    if not settings['um_per_px'] is None:
1382        df[f"{settings['compartment']}_area"] = df[f"{settings['compartment']}_area"] * (settings['um_per_px'] ** 2)
1383        settings['min_area_bin'] = settings['min_area_bin'] * (settings['um_per_px'] ** 2)
1384

1386    
1387    df = annotate_conditions(
1388        df=df, 
1389        cells=settings['cell_types'], 
1390        cell_loc=settings['cell_plate_metadata'],

1392        pathogen_loc=settings['pathogen_plate_metadata'],
1393        treatments=settings['treatments'], 
1394        treatment_loc=settings['treatment_plate_metadata']
1395    )
1396    
1397    if settings['group_column'] not in df.columns:
1398        print(f"{settings['group_column']} not found in DataFrame, please choose from:")
1399        for col in df.columns:
1400            print(col)
1401    
1402    df = df.dropna(subset=[settings['group_column']])
1403    df = _calculate_volume_bins(df, settings['compartment'], settings['min_area_bin'], settings['max_bins'], settings['verbose'])
1404    output['data'] = df
1405    
1406    
1407    if settings['level'] == 'plateID':
1408        prc_column = 'plateID'
1409    else:
1410        prc_column = 'prc'
1411    
1412    # Perform chi-squared test and plot
1413    results_df, pairwise_results_df, fig = plot_proportion_stacked_bars(settings, df, settings['group_column'], bin_column=f"{settings['compartment']}_volume_bin", prc_column=prc_column, level=settings['level'], cmap=settings['cmap'])
1414    
1415    # Extract bin labels and indices for formatting the legend in the correct order
1416    bin_labels = df[f"{settings['compartment']}_volume_bin"].cat.categories if pd.api.types.is_categorical_dtype(df[f"{settings['compartment']}_volume_bin"]) else sorted(df[f"{settings['compartment']}_volume_bin"].unique())
1417    bin_indices = range(1, len(bin_labels) + 1)
1418    legend_labels = [f"{index}: {label}" for index, label in zip(bin_indices, bin_labels)]
1419    
1420    # Update legend with formatted labels, maintaining correct order
1421    volume_unit = "px³" if settings['um_per_px'] is None else "µm³"
1422    plt.legend(legend_labels, title=f'Volume Range ({volume_unit})', bbox_to_anchor=(1.05, 1), loc='upper left')
1423    plt.ylim(0, 1)
1424    
1425    output['chi_squared'] = results_df
1426
1427    if settings['save']:
1428        # Save DataFrame to CSV
1429        output_dir = os.path.join(settings['src'][0], 'results', 'analyze_endodyogeny')
1430        os.makedirs(output_dir, exist_ok=True)
1431        output_path = os.path.join(output_dir, 'chi_squared_results.csv')
1432        output_path_data = os.path.join(output_dir, 'data.csv')
1433        output_path_pairwise = os.path.join(output_dir, 'chi_squared_results.csv')
1434        output_path_fig = os.path.join(output_dir, 'chi_squared_results.pdf')
1435        fig.savefig(output_path_fig, dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
1436        results_df.to_csv(output_path, index=False)
1437        df.to_csv(output_path_data, index=False)
1438        pairwise_results_df.to_csv(output_path_pairwise, index=False)
1439        print(f"Chi-squared results saved to {output_path}")
1440        
1441    plt.show()     
1442
1443    return output

def generate_score_heatmap(settings): 
1549def generate_score_heatmap(settings):
1550    
1551    def group_cv_score(csv, plate=1, column='c3', data_column='pred'):
1552        
1553        df = pd.read_csv(csv)
1554        if 'columnID' in df.columns:
1555            df = df[df['columnID']==column]
1556        elif 'column' in df.columns:
1557            df['columnID'] = df['column']
1558            df = df[df['columnID']==column]
1559        if not plate is None:
1560            df['plateID'] = f"plate{plate}"
1561        grouped_df = df.groupby(['plateID', 'rowID', 'columnID'])[data_column].mean().reset_index()
1562        grouped_df['prc'] = grouped_df['plateID'].astype(str) + '_' + grouped_df['rowID'].astype(str) + '_' + grouped_df['columnID'].astype(str)
1563        return grouped_df
1564
1565    def calculate_fraction_mixed_condition(csv, plate=1, column='c3', control_sgrnas = ['TGGT1_220950_1', 'TGGT1_233460_4']):
1566        df = pd.read_csv(csv)  
1567        df = df[df['column_name']==column]
1568        if plate not in df.columns:
1569            df['plateID'] = f"plate{plate}"
1570        df = df[df['grna_name'].str.match(f'^{control_sgrnas[0]}$|^{control_sgrnas[1]}$')]
1571        grouped_df = df.groupby(['plateID', 'rowID', 'columnID'])['count'].sum().reset_index()
1572        grouped_df = grouped_df.rename(columns={'count': 'total_count'})
1573        merged_df = pd.merge(df, grouped_df, on=['plateID', 'rowID', 'column_name'])
1574        merged_df['fraction'] = merged_df['count'] / merged_df['total_count']
1575        merged_df['prc'] = merged_df['plateID'].astype(str) + '_' + merged_df['rowID'].astype(str) + '_' + merged_df['column_name'].astype(str)
1576        return merged_df
1577
1578    def plot_multi_channel_heatmap(df, column='c3', cmap='coolwarm'):
1579        """
1580        Plot a heatmap with multiple channels as columns.
1581
1582        Parameters:
1583        - df: DataFrame with scores for different channels.
1584        - column: Column to filter by (default is 'c3').
1585        """
1586        # Extract row number and convert to integer for sorting
1587        df['row_num'] = df['rowID'].str.extract(r'(\d+)').astype(int)
1588
1589        # Filter and sort by plate, row, and column
1590        df = df[df['columnID'] == column]
1591        df = df.sort_values(by=['plateID', 'row_num', 'columnID'])
1592
1593        # Drop temporary 'row_num' column after sorting
1594        df = df.drop('row_num', axis=1)
1595
1596        # Create a new column combining plate, row, and column for the index
1597        df['plate_row_col'] = df['plateID'] + '-' + df['rowID'] + '-' + df['columnID']
1598
1599        # Set 'plate_row_col' as the index
1600        df.set_index('plate_row_col', inplace=True)
1601
1602        # Extract only numeric data for the heatmap
1603        heatmap_data = df.select_dtypes(include=[float, int])
1604
1605        # Plot heatmap with square boxes, no annotations, and 'viridis' colormap
1606        plt.figure(figsize=(12, 8))
1607        sns.heatmap(
1608            heatmap_data,
1609            cmap=cmap,
1610            cbar=True,
1611            square=True,
1612            annot=False
1613        )
1614
1615        plt.title("Heatmap of Prediction Scores for All Channels")
1616        plt.xlabel("Channels")
1617        plt.ylabel("Plate-Row-Column")
1618        plt.tight_layout()
1619
1620        # Save the figure object and return it
1621        fig = plt.gcf()
1622        plt.show()
1623
1624        return fig

1627    def combine_classification_scores(folders, csv_name, data_column, plate=1, column='c3'):
1628        # Ensure `folders` is a list
1629        if isinstance(folders, str):
1630            folders = [folders]
1631
1632        ls = []  # Initialize ls to store found CSV file paths
1633
1634        # Iterate over the provided folders
1635        for folder in folders:
1636            sub_folders = os.listdir(folder)  # Get sub-folder list
1637            for sub_folder in sub_folders:  # Iterate through sub-folders
1638                path = os.path.join(folder, sub_folder)  # Join the full path
1639
1640                if os.path.isdir(path):  # Check if it’s a directory
1641                    csv = os.path.join(path, csv_name)  # Join path to the CSV file
1642                    if os.path.exists(csv):  # If CSV exists, add to list
1643                        ls.append(csv)
1644                    else:
1645                        print(f'No such file: {csv}')
1646
1647        # Initialize combined DataFrame
1648        combined_df = None
1649        print(f'Found {len(ls)} CSV files')
1650
1651        # Loop through all collected CSV files and process them
1652        for csv_file in ls:
1653            df = pd.read_csv(csv_file)  # Read CSV into DataFrame
1654            df = df[df['columnID']==column]
1655            if not plate is None:
1656                df['plateID'] = f"plate{plate}"
1657            # Group the data by 'plateID', 'rowID', and 'columnID'
1658            grouped_df = df.groupby(['plateID', 'rowID', 'columnID'])[data_column].mean().reset_index()
1659            # Use the CSV filename to create a new column name
1660            folder_name = os.path.dirname(csv_file).replace(".csv", "")
1661            new_column_name = os.path.basename(f"{folder_name}_{data_column}")
1662            print(new_column_name)
1663            grouped_df = grouped_df.rename(columns={data_column: new_column_name})
1664
1665            # Merge into the combined DataFrame
1666            if combined_df is None:
1667                combined_df = grouped_df
1668            else:
1669                combined_df = pd.merge(combined_df, grouped_df, on=['plateID', 'rowID', 'columnID'], how='outer')
1670        combined_df['prc'] = combined_df['plateID'].astype(str) + '_' + combined_df['rowID'].astype(str) + '_' + combined_df['columnID'].astype(str)
1671        return combined_df

1673    def calculate_mae(df):
1674        """
1675        Calculate the MAE between each channel's predictions and the fraction column for all rows.
1676        """
1677        # Extract numeric columns excluding 'fraction' and 'prc'
1678        channels = df.drop(columns=['fraction', 'prc']).select_dtypes(include=[float, int])
1679
1680        mae_data = []
1681
1682        # Compute MAE for each channel with 'fraction' for all rows
1683        for column in channels.columns:
1684            for index, row in df.iterrows():
1685                mae = mean_absolute_error([row['fraction']], [row[column]])
1686                mae_data.append({'Channel': column, 'MAE': mae, 'Row': row['prc']})
1687
1688        # Convert the list of dictionaries to a DataFrame
1689        mae_df = pd.DataFrame(mae_data)
1690        return mae_df
1691

1694    df = df[df['grna_name']==settings['fraction_grna']]

1698    cv_df = cv_df[[settings['data_column_cv'], 'prc']]
1699    merged_df = pd.merge(merged_df, cv_df, on=['prc'])

1719    def _analyze_and_visualize_grna_correlation(df, grna_list, save_folder, save=False):
1720        """
1721        Analyze and visualize the correlation matrix of gRNAs based on their fractions and overlap.
1722
1723        Parameters:
1724        df (pd.DataFrame): DataFrame with columns ['grna', 'fraction', 'prc'].
1725        grna_list (list): List of gRNAs to include in the correlation analysis.
1726        save_folder (str): Path to the folder where figures and data will be saved.
1727
1728        Returns:
1729        pd.DataFrame: Correlation matrix of the gRNAs.
1730        """
1731        # Filter the DataFrame to include only rows with gRNAs in the list
1732        filtered_df = df[df['grna'].isin(grna_list)]
1733
1734        # Pivot the data to create a prc-by-gRNA matrix, using fractions as values
1735        pivot_df = filtered_df.pivot_table(index='prc', columns='grna', values='fraction', aggfunc='sum').fillna(0)
1736
1737        # Compute the correlation matrix
1738        correlation_matrix = pivot_df.corr()
1739        
1740        if save:
1741            # Save the correlation matrix
1742            correlation_matrix.to_csv(os.path.join(save_folder, 'correlation_matrix.csv'))
1743        
1744        # Visualize the correlation matrix as a heatmap
1745        plt.figure(figsize=(10, 8))
1746        sns.heatmap(correlation_matrix, annot=False, cmap='coolwarm', cbar=True)
1747        plt.title('gRNA Correlation Matrix')
1748        plt.xlabel('gRNAs')
1749        plt.ylabel('gRNAs')
1750        plt.tight_layout()
1751        
1752        if save:
1753            correlation_fig_path = os.path.join(save_folder, 'correlation_matrix_heatmap.pdf')
1754            plt.savefig(correlation_fig_path, dpi=300)
1755        
1756        plt.show()
1757
1758        return correlation_matrix
1759
1760    def _compute_effect_sizes(correlation_matrix, grna_dict, save_folder, save=False):
1761        """
1762        Compute and visualize the effect sizes of gRNAs given fixed effect sizes for a subset of gRNAs.
1763
1764        Parameters:
1765        correlation_matrix (pd.DataFrame): Correlation matrix of gRNAs.
1766        grna_dict (dict): Dictionary of gRNAs with fixed effect sizes {grna_name: effect_size}.
1767        save_folder (str): Path to the folder where figures and data will be saved.
1768
1769        Returns:
1770        pd.Series: Effect sizes of all gRNAs.
1771        """
1772        # Ensure the matrix is symmetric and normalize values to 0-1
1773        corr_matrix = correlation_matrix.copy()
1774        corr_matrix = (corr_matrix - corr_matrix.min().min()) / (corr_matrix.max().max() - corr_matrix.min().min())
1775
1776        # Initialize the effect sizes with dtype float
1777        effect_sizes = pd.Series(0.0, index=corr_matrix.index)
1778
1779        # Set the effect sizes for the specified gRNAs
1780        for grna, size in grna_dict.items():
1781            effect_sizes[grna] = size
1782
1783        # Propagate the effect sizes
1784        for grna in corr_matrix.index:
1785            if grna not in grna_dict:
1786                # Weighted sum of correlations with the fixed gRNAs
1787                effect_sizes[grna] = np.dot(corr_matrix.loc[grna], effect_sizes) / np.sum(corr_matrix.loc[grna])
1788        
1789        if save:
1790            # Save the effect sizes
1791            effect_sizes.to_csv(os.path.join(save_folder, 'effect_sizes.csv'))
1792
1793        # Visualization
1794        plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
1795        sns.barplot(x=effect_sizes.index, y=effect_sizes.values, palette="viridis", hue=None, legend=False)
1796
1797        #for i, val in enumerate(effect_sizes.values):
1798        #    plt.text(i, val + 0.02, f"{val:.2f}", ha='center', va='bottom', fontsize=9)
1799        plt.title("Effect Sizes of gRNAs")
1800        plt.xlabel("gRNAs")
1801        plt.ylabel("Effect Size")
1802        plt.xticks(rotation=45)
1803        plt.tight_layout()
1804        
1805        if save:
1806            effect_sizes_fig_path = os.path.join(save_folder, 'effect_sizes_barplot.pdf')
1807            plt.savefig(effect_sizes_fig_path, dpi=300)
1808        
1809        plt.show()
1810
1811        return effect_sizes
1812    
1813    # Ensure the save folder exists
1814    save_folder = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(csv_file), 'post_regression_analysis_results')
1815    os.makedirs(save_folder, exist_ok=True)
1816    
1817    # Load the data
1818    df = pd.read_csv(csv_file)
1819

1822    effect_sizes = _compute_effect_sizes(correlation_matrix, grna_dict, save_folder, save)
